basics.name: Keishu Aruga
basics.label: PointCloud Research / Graduate Student
basics.summary: Graduate student specializing in 3D point cloud analysis, AI, and plant phenotyping. Passionate about using technology to solve real-world problems.

work.name: Imvision Labs
work.position: Data Scientist Intern (3D Point Cloud & AI)
work.summary: Conduct research and development on AI-driven 3D point cloud solutions for infrastructure analysis.
highlights: Designed, developed, and evaluated deep learning models tailored for 3D point cloud processing.
Created and deployed algorithms for detecting overhead power lines from LiDAR and point cloud data.
Classified bridges and roadways within point cloud datasets and extracted relevant structural parameters.

education.institution: The University of Tokyo, Graduate School of Agricultural and Life Sciences
research: Estimation of leaf area using 3D point cloud analysis.
Simulation of light distribution using ray tracing techniques.

education.institution: The University of Tokyo, Faculty of Agriculture
education.summary: Completed undergraduate research on plant structure analysis.

projects.name: Leaf Area Estimation from Point Clouds
projects.summary: Developed a method to estimate leaf area from 3D point cloud models using ray tracing and image-based comparison.
highlights: High correlation with manually measured leaf area.
